children.name: when people of different races come together or are kept apart
integration
children.definition: /ˌɪntɪˈgreɪʃən, ˌɪntəˈgreɪʃən/  the bringing or coming together of people of different races so that they live and work peacefully together:
examples: hòa nhập
▪ In the 1960s the government passed a law to promote racial integration in schools.
Vào những năm 1960 chính phủ thông qua đạo luật tiến hành nhập cư chung tộc trong trường học
▪ Members of extreme right wing parties are completely opposed to the integration of blacks into white South African society.
Các thành viên của đảng cash tả cực đoan hoàn toàn phản đối việc nhập cư của người da màu với xã hội người Nam Phi da trắng
integrated/ˈɪntɪgreɪtəd, ˈɪntəgreɪtəd/ [adjective] : hòa nhập
▪ Aru was a perfectly integrated society. one in which all the different races lived and worked together peacefully.
Aru là một xã hội hoàn toàn hòa nhập,trong đó tất cả các chủng tộc khác nhau sống và làm việc cùng nhau một cách hòa bình

children.name: segregation
children.definition: /ˌsegrɪˈgeɪʃən/  keeping people of different races apart and making them live, work, or study separately, especially because one race believes that it is better than the other:
examples: sự tách biệt
▪ The US Supreme Court ruled in 1954 that segregation in schools was unconstitutional.
Tòa án tối cáo Hoa Kỳ đã ra điều luật năm 1954 rằng sự tách biệt trong trường học là trái với hiến pháp
▪ Legal segregation may be gone, but the idea of segregation survives, as middle class black families shun white areas, preferring to live in suburbs of their own.
Sự tách biệt về pháp lý có thể biến mất nhưng ý tưởng tách biệt vẫn tồn tại vì các gai đình trung lưu da màu tránh xa khu vực có người da trắng và thích sống cuộc sống hẻo lánh của họ
segregated/ˈsegrɪgeɪtɪd, ˈsegrɪgeɪtəd/ [adjective] :tách biệt
▪ Segregated restaurants are no longer allowed.
Các nhà hàng tách biệt không còn được cho phép nữa

children.name: people of a particular race or nationality
race
children.definition: one of the main groups of people in the world, who have the same colour of skin and physical appearance as each other : chủng tộc, sắc tộc
examples: People should be treated equally, regardless of their race, age, or sex.

children.name: people of all races and religions
examples: Studies are under way to find out why men of some races are more prone to some forms of cancer than others.
An increasing number of people in the country are ofmixedrace (= with parents of different races) .

children.name: race relationsthe relationship between people of different races: quan hệ chủng tộc
examples: The group is working to improve race relations in our cities.

children.name: color
children.definition: colour /  thecolourof someone’s skin, which shows which race they belong to, especially whether they are black or white: màu da (ý nói chủng tộc, sắc tộc)
examples: People of all colors and nationalities were at the ceremony.
You can’t judge people by the colour of their skin.

children.name: ethnic
children.definition: relating to a particular race of people : dân tộc
examples: ethnic group/ minority
[a group of people of a particular race or nationality living in a place where most other people are of a different race] dân tộc thiểu số
The Indonesians of the city form a distinct ethnic group.
In the large cities of Africa, where different ethnic groups with many different languages are thrown together, people communicate in English or Swahili.
ethnic origin/ background[the ethnic group that someone belongs to] nguồn gốc dân tộc
fighting in Bosnia between people from different ethnic backgrounds
In California it is illegal to refuse to do business with someone because of their race or ethnic origin.
ethnically[adv]
There is probably no major public university campus quite as racially and ethnically diverse as the University of California.

children.name: ethnicity
children.definition: formal one of the group of people of a particular race or nationality who live in a place where there are other races or nationalities : chủng tộc, sắc tộc (của ai đó trong khi học sống trong một môi trường nhiều sắc tộc)
examples: I couldn’t tell her ethnicity from her last name.
Ethnicity should not be a factor in hiring decisions.

children.name: The Bay Area is a place where people of many ethnicities live together in relative harmony
sb who believes that their race is better than other races
racist
children.definition: sb who believes that their race is much better than other races: người phân biệt chủng tộc
examples: The minister denied that he was a racist, but called for tougher controls on immigration.
racist[adj] [C2] phân biệt chủng tộc
racist organizations like the British National Party and Combat 18

children.name: white supremacist
children.definition: sb who believes that white people are better than other races and that other races should be kept at a lower level: người chủ trương ưu thế của người da trắng
examples: Many white supremacists have chosen to set up compounds in unpopulated areas of the American West.

children.name: multiracial
children.definition: / multicultural a multiracial or multicultural society, school, community etc is one in which people from several different races live together or work together, especially in a friendly way: đa chủng tộc/văn hóa
examples: Britain became a multiracial society in the 1960s and 70s, after large-scale immigration from the West Indies and the Indian subcontinent.

children.name: racial
children.definition: connected with sb's race or happening between people of different races : chủng tộc
examples: He had a vision of a society living in racial harmony.
racial discrimination/ prejudice/ violence/ attack
Some people complained of racial discrimination in the way housing was allocated.
Racial violence used to be commonplace on the streets of the city.
racial harmony
In Jamaica black and white people have lived together in racial harmony for many years.
racial profilingthe practice of police stopping some people only because of their race
Local police deny that have used racial profiling when stopping motorists. s
racially[adv] [C1]
Kolbe grew up a vibrant, racially integrated quarter of Cape Town.
racially motivated
Police suspect that the attack could be racially motivated.
Raciallymotivatedassaults on Asians are increasing.

children.name: cosmopolitan
children.definition: a cosmopolitancity, district, society etc is one in which people of many different races and nationalities live or go, which is therefore lively and interesting : quốc tế, toàn thế giới (nói về một nơi có nhiều chủng tộc chung sống)
examples: Istanbul is a great cosmopolitan city, situated between East and West.
She grew up in an apartment in a cosmopolitan district of Chicago.
The thing I like most about living in London is that it’s so cosmopolitan.

children.name: mixed marriage
children.definition: marriage between people of different races: hôn nhân đa chủng tộc
examples: Mixed marriages are becoming more and more commonplace.

children.name: interracial
children.definition: between people of different races: giữa các chủng tộc
examples: The danger of an interracial war in South Africa still exists.
There has to be fairness and justice for black people before you can achieve a spirit of interracial harmony.

children.name: interracial marriage: hôn nhân giữa các chủng tộc
examples: Interracial marriages are common in England these days.

children.name: when people are treated badly because of their race
racism
children.definition: unfair treatment of people because of their race: phân biệt chủng tộc
examples: The company has been accused of racism after firing three Algerian workers.
the struggle against racism in our society.
The authorities are taking steps to combat/fight/tackle racism in schools.
institutionalizedracism[racism that has happened for so long in a society or organization, that it has become accepted as normal] chế độ phân biệt chủng tộc
Institutionalized racism pervaded British society, and immigrant workers found themselves in unskilled jobs and with low social status.

racist[adj] [C2] [disapproving] raciststatements, jokes, behaviour, or opinions are based on a dislike of people from other races and a feeling that your race is better than others: phân biệt chủng tộc
racist attitudes
a comedian well known for his racist and sexist jokes
An African-American friend told me that she is subjected to racist behavior every day - at work, in the mall, in the park.

children.name: native
children.definition: relating to the first people to live in an area : bản địa / bản xứ
examples: The Aborigines are the native inhabitants of Australia.
the native population
native customs and traditions

children.name: tribe
children.definition: a group of people, often of related families, who live together, sharing the same language, culture and history, especially those who do not live in towns or cities : bộ tộc, bộ lạc
examples: a tribe of Amazonian Indians
the Masai tribe
tribal[adj] [C2] relating to a tribe : thuộc về bộ lạc
tribal dress/leaders

children.name: [informal figurative]
examples: The fierce triballoyaltyamong soccer supporters leads to violence between opposing fans.
